definition: to store up provisions against a war

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff
to recruit surrendered enemy and deserters (idiom); to gather together a gang of villains
refers to the Yellow Turbans Peasant Uprising at the end of later Han (from 184)
elite soldiers, ample provisions (idiom); well-prepared forces/preparations for war are in an advanced state
Youzhou, ancient province in north Hebei and Liaoning/Fanyang 範陽|范阳 ancient city near modern Beijing
to enlist enemy or rebel soldiers by offering amnesty/to bring to negotiated surrender
land tax/money and grain (given as tax or tribute)
strong soldiers/make the military powerful (political slogan)
